name: Amazon question/answer data
desc: This dataset contains question and answer data from Amazon, totaling around 1.4 million answered questions.

name: IMDB Reviews
desc: This is a database for binary sentiment classification substantially more data than previous benchmark datasets.

name: Machine Translation of Various Languages
desc: This dataset consists of training data for four European languages

name: Multi-Domain Sentiment Dataset
desc: A massive variety of Amazon products along with their corresponding reviews

name: Stanford Sentiment Treebank
desc: Dataset for training a model to identify sentiment with the use of longer phases with its 10,000+ Rotten Tomatoes reviews

name: Twitter US Airline Sentiment
desc: Analyze how travelers in February 2015 expressed their feelings on Twitter

name: 20 Newsgroups
desc: A collection featuring 20,000 documents that covers 20 newsgroups and subjects

name: Rueters News Dataset
desc: Originally appearing in 1987, this dataset has been labeled, indexed, and compiled for use in machine learning.

name: ArXiv
desc: This massive 270 GB dataset features all arXiv research papers in fulltext.

name: The WikiQA Corpus
desc: This publicly-available Q&A dataset was initially compiled to aid in all open-domain question answering research.

name: UCI's Spambase Data set
desc: This dataset was created by a team at HP (Hewlett-Packard) to help create a spam filter. It contains a litanie of emails previously labeled as spam by users.

name: Yelp Open Dataset
desc: This Yelp dataset features 8.5M+ reviews of over 160,000 businesses. It also has 200,000+ pictures and spans across 8 major metropolitan areas.

name: Enron Email Dataset
desc: This dataset contains 500,000+ messages of Enron officials' emails and is especially of use for anyone looking to expand their understanding of the inner-workings of email tools.

name: Google Books Ngrams
desc: A data set containing Google Books n-gram corpora. This data set is freely available on Amazon S3 in a Hadoop friendly file format and is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License.

name: Wikipedia Links Data
desc: This Google dataset contains approximately 13 million documents with each containing a hyperlink (one minimum each) that goes to an English wikipedia page

name: Sentiment140
desc: Sentiment140 allows you to discover the sentiment of a brand, product or topic on Twitter

name: Twenty Newsgroups Dataset
desc: This data set consists of 20000 messages taken from 20 newsgroups

name: WordNet
desc: WordNet is a large lexical database of English. Nouns, verbs, adjectives and adverbs are grouped into sets of cognitive synonyms (synsets), each expressing a distinct concept.

name: YouTubers-saying-things
desc: Dataset containing popular YouTuber's video subtitles
